reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Looking for a reliable and comfortable wireless mouse.
reviews.reviewText: The EVGA X20 Wireless Gaming Mouse is a solid option for gamers who are looking for a reliable and comfortable wireless mouse.Firstly, the design of the mouse is sleek and ergonomic, making it comfortable to hold for extended gaming sessions. The matte black finish gives it a premium look and feel. The mouse is also lightweight, which is great for quick and precise movements.The wireless performance of the X20 is impressive. It uses 2.4GHz wireless technology, which provides a strong and stable connection with low latency. The mouse has a range of up to 30 feet, allowing for freedom of movement without any lag. Additionally, the battery life is excellent, lasting up to 30 hours on a single charge.The X20 features a high-precision optical sensor with adjustable DPI settings, ranging from 800 to 15,000 DPI. This allows for smooth and accurate tracking, perfect for FPS, MOBA, and other gaming genres. The onboard memory also lets you save your preferred DPI settings, making it easy to switch between different sensitivities on the fly.Customization options are plentiful with the X20. It has 7 programmable buttons, including a DPI adjustment button and two side buttons. The EVGA Unleash software allows for extensive customization, including button mapping, macro recording, and RGB lighting customization. The RGB lighting is subtle but adds a nice touch to the overall aesthetics.One downside of the X20 is that it is only compatible with Windows operating systems. Mac and Linux users will not be able to fully utilize the mouse's software features. Additionally, the software can be a bit finicky at times, requiring occasional updates to resolve any bugs or issues.Overall, the EVGA X20 Wireless Gaming Mouse offers a great combination of performance, comfort, and customization options. It's a reliable wireless gaming mouse that won't break the bank.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars EVGA FTW (Update Your Firmware Before Use)
reviews.reviewText: You will NEED to download the EVGA software that you'll use with you mouse and perform the recommended firmware update before using to maximize the life and performance of your mouse.Start off by saying EVGA has been a rock-solid name and brand in the gaming community for a very long time and I will admit that even though EVGA makes solid hardware that was in the GPU MOBO PSU areas of gaming. My personal experience with this brand might and probably will differ from yours and that's okay because this is based on a personal experience and a multi-year relationship gaming around EVGA. No more Video Cards but stellar mouse and keyboard(s). I'm going to share some of my thoughts and opinions on this device. Rather you agree or not well let's just say maybe we can help others decide on their purchase.ProsPricing at time of purchase ($19.00) USABluetooth/Wireless/WiredTriple Sensor System5 Profiles with customizable settingsLEDs with Customizable settingsSoftware to update your mouse and adjust settings Leds and such.Macro(s)I use Bluetooth on my PC and Wireless on my Xbox Series X (Separate playing of course but that's an option)Customizable sensor settings for mats and it has an option to set for gaming or office or basic use. It really works but I feel maybe it adjusts the DPI sensitivity automatically maybe don't know a guess.ConsBattery seems to die quicker than my other Bluetooth mouse(s)(Razor Logitech Steel Series)Cord gets in the way if plugged in to the keyboard usb and is too short to plug in PC (used for charging and wired option)The Sniper button sits too high and off set for me and i am a claw type of gamer. (big hand friendly)The weight seems a bit too light. I'm used to heavy, but you be the judge.ConclusionA well-rounded budget option for anybody wanting to use a Bluetooth and wireless mouse. (Time of purchase)I did charge the mouse completely before using and update the firmware and would recommend you do the same before you use it. make sure before your return window expires that your mouse is working in every aspect it has to offer. I have pushed this mouse hard from the start and it's amazing. Time will tell and ill update in the event of a failure or issue. Multiple clicks and farming sticks later we are still in the game baby. A thumbs up if i helped and for effort. Enjoy your EVGA purchase and welcome to EVGA family.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
reviews.reviewText: The house itself is some what comfortable and rgb effects are OK. Feels a bit cheaply made but nothing that will bother you for the price. Great value over all.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Kinda under rated
reviews.reviewText: I bought this mouse more out of curiosity and price. I'm kinda impressed. I bought a n65 corsair before this one to replace my g602 and this is objectively better. Tracking and pulling rate is pretty good. Software is dated, but simple and works. Its got a lot of newer features. I'd pick it up if your looking for a heavier gaming mouse at its price right now its a steal.proergonomic one of the few mice wear the side buttons feel better placedheavygood trackfeature rich side scroll buttons and macroscheap due to no one wanting themconsbattery life time isn't the greatestmost likely to lose support due to low popularity

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Very nice mouse with excellent build quality for the price. Software is definitely useable, and definitely better than others I've used. battery life is fine, though the default sleep settings sleep much too quick but is easy to change in the software.My only complaint is that the mouse is quite narrow for my bigger hands. It is a very personal issue, so I still think the mouse is quite good.Overall a very solid mouse for the price, as long as you don't need a big mouse.

I have both x17 wired and x20 Wireless Evga mice. I'd take the x17 over the wireless x20. x17 has more features, x and y dpi able to go over 1000hz up to 8000hz. Slightly lighter. but x20 isn't bad either.

reviews.reviewTitle: Buen ratón, no con la mejor batería.
reviews.reviewText: Muy cómodo, de buena calidad. Pero la batería le dura muy poco lo que provoca conectarlo alámbricamente.

reviews.reviewTitle: Muy satisfecho, buena calidad y funcionalidad
reviews.reviewText: Llevo usándolo poco más de tres meses y hasta el momento me ha agradado mucho, se programa fácil, su batería es buena y verdaderamente cuando lo cargo ni me doy cuenta que tiene el cable puesto, solo los leds no son tan fuertes pero es un mouse, así que no se puede pedir mucho
